title: Cannot send mail message
content:
Good morning

Opening Thunderbird this morning, I saw 3400 messages in the Inbox all labelled "Cannot send mail"

Since then I am unable to send mail

I then downloaded eM client and using the same SMTP settings, was able to send mail

I backed up Thunderbird using Mozbackup, uninstalled Thunderbird, downloaded a new version (102.11.2) and restored the backup

The same problem persists

Is there perhaps a corrupt file in the Profiles folder causing this?

Thank you Regards Chris

title: Firefox and Thunderbird have "Invalid Profiles" after system power cycle
content:
Desktop running Windows 10, 64 bit installation. Recently after power cycling my PC both Firefox Version 113.0.2 and Thunderbird Version 102.11.2 when launched, indicate that they have never been set up. Each programs respective Profile "????????.default" directory contain an additional file named "Invalidprefs.js". Each time this occurs, I can resolve it by erasing the entire contents of the "????????.default" directory and copy the entire contents of a good profile directory from an earlier backup. This issue started happening around the second week of May. I have been using both Firefox and Thunderbird for about 20 years and never had an issue. It appears to be related to the recent updates that where released.

I have had Firefox Version 113.0.2 running on my laptop which has Windows 11, 64 bit without issue. I installed Thunderbird Version 102.11.2 onto this laptop to see if it had the same issue as the Windows 10 desktop system. So far it works just fine.

Please let me know if you need additional information. I do not want want to run Thunderbird on my laptop permanently. I have considered downgrading Firefox to Version 112.0.2 and Thunderbird to 102.10.1 on the desktop. Rather not go though the extra work to downgrade if I don't have to.

Thank you
creator: draket

title: Incoming server already exists. First time install. First account setup.
content:
I used configuration given me by Frontier (auto config resulted in nonsense). It stalled on checking password, so I checked for solutions to that and found: "I suggest deleting the password and letting Thunderbird just check account settings. I have seen this long test many times. After the account is confirmed, you can then enter password."

So I did that. I clicked re-test to be sure the config was right. I got this message: "The following settings were found by probing the server" The settings were exactly the same as my original input, thus confirming my settings were correct.

When I clicked Done, I got an "Error Creating Account" window with the message "Incoming server already exists."

I checked for solutions to that error, but none of them seemed to fit my situation since I never installed Thunderbird before, and this is the first and only account I attempted to set up.

So what do I do? I need to get my messages really soon, as I normally receive 30-40 per day, and Outlook quit on me several days ago.

Thanks, Jon

title: Status bar doesn't clear "Searching folder..."
content:
Focus on an IMAP folder and watch the status bar diligently show the folders being processed on the server. When this is done, the final text in the status bar is "*account_name*: Searching folder...". But the search is complete. I believe this is a simple bit of housekeeping : when all folders have been searched, clear this label. Or if the process is async and we don't know when the search is complete, clear this generic text if it has not been changed in 2 seconds.

Any other suggestions? (Other than "ignore it"? :) )

Thanks.
creator: Starbuck

title: Password Issues Provider is ATT
content: Good Day all you wonderful Thunderbird users, Been using Thunderbird for many years, have a minor issue, been using Thunderbird to access my sbcglobal.net email for the past 20 plus years, and back in April, I couldn't login, changed the password, updated details in Thunderbird, didn't work. Contact ATT Tech support advised to try to login via their portal currently.com, try to sign in, advised to change password suspicious activity, do the whole forgot password thing. Notice a telephone # not mine on my confirm who you are, so use security questions, advise ATT about the #, they said they will pass the ticket on to upper support. Long story short for the past 2 months hackers have had access to my email placed orders, transferred money via accounts, not mine, sent money via Wester Union and sent over 10K porn emails and my draft folder continues to be filled daily with porn emails and sent out daily about 1K, my ip is a disaster. Then one day while deleting drafts I see an odd email that has smtp.mail.att.net,587,k******@sbcglobal.net,owxwe*************** I take this information and input into Thunderbird bam work, also located in the same email is the outgoing mail details different password, input into Thunderbird works. Contact Office of the President at ATT, speak to his "executive assistant" who is amazingly nice at first after about 3 conversations, she advises she will have their executive team look into it. Send those above login details to a good friend in Canada, inputs it into Thunderbird and Mailbird works. I advise ATT "executive assistant" that this info works in Thunderbird even though it does not work at Currently.com, her reply "If it doesn't work in Currently.com or att.net, you have malware, or viruses on your pc allowing hackers to use your pc to send and open emails?" I advise I changed the password daily now, and the changed password works via Currently.com and att.com but not via Thunderbird but the info the Draft email has works fine via Thunderbird, your servers have this data an it needs to be removed. Not there problem its a thunderbird/third party software issue. I have Bitdefender, and SuperAntiSpyware and check my pc daily, no viruses, malware or trojans etc. Is it truly a Thunderbird issue or ?? This has been on going for over 2 months now and get nowhere with ATT their solution delete the email and create a new one, but all my bills and accounts online are sent to this email, and I have had it for 20 plus years, I have numerous emails I need to save, as a dear friend passed away a few years ago and I have all their emails saved, along with personal emails I need. Any help, advice and your expertise appreciated. Keith C
creator: kcmib2
